intro: Exellodendron, commonly known as the African sandthorn, is a genus of flowering plants native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and woody structure. The plants typically grow as shrubs or small trees, often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Exellodendron species are known for their ability to thrive in harsh conditions, making them resilient to drought and poor soil. Their ecological importance includes providing habitat and food for various wildlife species.
